db:abstract.db:para: The QVector2D class represents a vector or vertex in 2D space.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.6.

db:listitem.db:para: QVector2D is part of Painting ClassesRendering in 3D

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QVector2D class can also be used to represent vertices in 2D space. We therefore do not need to provide a separate vertex class.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D::QVector2D()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null vector, i.e. with coordinates (0, 0).

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVector2D::QVector2D(const QPoint &point)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with x and y coordinates from a 2D point.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVector2D::QVector2D(const QPointF &point)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with x and y coordinates from a 2D point.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVector2D::QVector2D(const QVector3D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with x and y coordinates from a 3D vector. The z coordinate of vector is dropped.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVector2D::QVector2D(const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with x and y coordinates from a 3D vector. The z and w coordinates of vector are dropped.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D::QVector2D(float xpos, float ypos)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with coordinates (xpos, ypos).

db:section.db:title: [since 5.1] float QVector2D::distanceToLine(const QVector2D &point, const QVector2D &direction) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the distance that this vertex is from a line defined by point and the unit vector direction.
If direction is a null vector, then it does not define a line. In that case, the distance from point to this vertex is returned.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.1] float QVector2D::distanceToPoint(const QVector2D &point) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the distance from this vertex to a point defined by the vertex point.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:section.db:title: [static] float QVector2D::dotProduct(const QVector2D &v1, const QVector2D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns the dot product of v1 and v2.

db:section.db:title: bool QVector2D::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the x and y coordinates are set to 0.0, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: float QVector2D::length() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the length of the vector from the origin.

db:section.db:title: float QVector2D::lengthSquared() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the squared length of the vector from the origin. This is equivalent to the dot product of the vector with itself.

db:section.db:title: void QVector2D::normalize()
db:section.db:para: Normalizes the currect vector in place. Nothing happens if this vector is a null vector or the length of the vector is very close to 1.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D QVector2D::normalized() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the normalized unit vector form of this vector.

If this vector is null, then a null vector is returned. If the length of the vector is very close to 1, then the vector will be returned as-is. Otherwise the normalized form of the vector of length 1 will be returned.

db:section.db:title: void QVector2D::setX(float x)
db:section.db:para: Sets the x coordinate of this point to the given x coordinate.

db:section.db:title: void QVector2D::setY(float y)
db:section.db:para: Sets the y coordinate of this point to the given y coordinate.

db:section.db:title: QPoint QVector2D::toPoint() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QPoint form of this 2D vector.

db:section.db:title: QPointF QVector2D::toPointF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QPointF form of this 2D vector.

db:section.db:title: QVector3D QVector2D::toVector3D() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 3D form of this 2D vector, with the z coordinate set to zero.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D QVector2D::toVector4D() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 4D form of this 2D vector, with the z and w coordinates set to zero.

db:section.db:title: float QVector2D::x() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the x coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: float QVector2D::y() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the y coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QVector2D::operator QVariant() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 2D vector as a QVariant.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D &QVector2D::operator*=(const QVector2D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies the components of this vector by the corresponding components in vector.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D &QVector2D::operator*=(float factor)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies this vector's coordinates by the given factor, and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D &QVector2D::operator+=(const QVector2D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Adds the given vector to this vector and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D &QVector2D::operator-=(const QVector2D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Subtracts the given vector from this vector and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D &QVector2D::operator/=(float divisor)
db:section.db:para: Divides this vector's coordinates by the given divisor, and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: bool qFuzzyCompare(const QVector2D &v1, const QVector2D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 and v2 are equal, allowing for a small fuzziness factor for floating-point comparisons; false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: bool operator!=(const QVector2D &v1, const QVector2D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 is not equal to v2; otherwise returns false. This operator uses an exact floating-point comparison.

db:section.db:title: const QVector2D operator*(const QVector2D &v1, const QVector2D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies the components of v1 by the corresponding components in v2.

db:section.db:title: const QVector2D operator*(const QVector2D &vector, float factor)
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the given vector, multiplied by the given factor.

db:section.db:title: const QVector2D operator*(float factor, const QVector2D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the given vector, multiplied by the given factor.

db:section.db:title: const QVector2D operator+(const QVector2D &v1, const QVector2D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QVector2D object that is the sum of the given vectors, v1 and v2; each component is added separately.

db:section.db:title: const QVector2D operator-(const QVector2D &vector)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a QVector2D object that is formed by changing the sign of the components of the given vector.
Equivalent to QVector2D(0,0) - vector.

db:section.db:title: const QVector2D operator-(const QVector2D &v1, const QVector2D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QVector2D object that is formed by subtracting v2 from v1; each component is subtracted separately.

db:section.db:title: const QVector2D operator/(const QVector2D &vector, float divisor)
db:section.db:para: Returns the QVector2D object formed by dividing all three components of the given vector by the given divisor.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &stream, const QVector2D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Writes the given vector to the given stream and returns a reference to the stream.

db:section.db:title: bool operator==(const QVector2D &v1, const QVector2D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 is equal to v2; otherwise returns false. This operator uses an exact floating-point comparison.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &stream, QVector2D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Reads a 2D vector from the given stream into the given vector and returns a reference to the stream.
